title: How to Activate Voice on Kindle

steps.title: Swipe down from the top of the screen and tap “Settings”.
steps.content: Swipe down from the top of the screen and tap “Settings”. This will take you a list of device settings.

steps.title: Tap the “Accessibility” button.
steps.content: Tap the “Accessibility” button. This button is located at the bottom of the Settings menu and will take you to a list of user assistance options.

steps.title: Tap “ON” next to “Screen Reader”.
steps.content: Tap “ON” next to “Screen Reader”. “Screen Reader” is located at the top of the accessibility settings under the “Vision Settings” header. The On/Off toggle is located to the right of the listing. The Screen Reader will describe any of the features you tap or interact with.

steps.title: Adjust the reading speed.
steps.content: Adjust the reading speed. Tap the “+” and “-” buttons next to “Reading Speed”. This is listed just below Screen Reader in the same menu.

steps.title: While reading, tap the screen to show the reading toolbar.
steps.content: While reading, tap the screen to show the reading toolbar. The reading toolbar appears at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap “Aa” (Settings) and select “More Options”.
steps.content: Tap “Aa” (Settings) and select “More Options”. The settings button is in the bottom left of the reading toolbar.

steps.title: Tap “On” next to “Text-to-Speech”.
steps.content: Tap “On” next to “Text-to-Speech”. Note that Text to Speech is not available for every Kindle book. Furthermore, Text to Speech is currently only available in the U.S. and in English. Amazon will list if Text to Speech is supported in the “Product Details” section of a book’s store page. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the screen to show the reading toolbar again, then tap the “Play” button.
steps.content: Tap the screen to show the reading toolbar again, then tap the “Play” button. The “Play” button is located next to the reading progress bar and will start reading the text aloud from the start of the current page. Sound will play through the Kindle's external speakers or you can use earphones plugged into the headphone jack.
